title: I have pen ink on the end of my highlighter pen. How can I remove this? - Quora

response.answer_text: The discoloration on the highlighter itself may be unsightly, but it’s not the problem. The problem is if the pen ink is making a smear on what you highlight. Run the highlighter back and forth repeatedly on a piece of scrap paper, holding it at different angles as necessary, until it no longer leaves a smear of the pen ink on the paper. If some discoloration remains in the highlighter tip, don’t worry about it. It may fade with time or never vanish entirely, but it will do no harm.

A2A thanks Grasp the end cap with a pair of rubber-coated pliers and twist the cap from the pen barrel if the cap is a twist-style cap. If it’s not, then insert the narrow tip of the craft knife between the seam where the end cap and pen barrel meet. Rock the craft knife back and forth slowly to pry the end cap out of the pen barrel. Insert the tweezers into the pen barrel, grasp the ink reservoir with them and pull it out.
